name: Base Weapons Categories System
description: Core definitions for all weapon base types focused on hand usage and combat style

weapon_system.design_philosophy: Three fundamental weapon usage philosophies with three combat style specializations each

two_handed.description: Weapons requiring both hands for effective use
two_handed.usage_philosophy: Maximum power and reach through two-handed weapon mastery

main_hand.description: Primary weapons for dominant hand use
main_hand.usage_philosophy: Balanced combat effectiveness with shield or off-hand compatibility

off_hand.description: Secondary weapons for non-dominant hand or dual-wielding
off_hand.usage_philosophy: Supplementary combat support and specialized techniques

melee.description: Close-quarters combat weapons for physical engagement
melee.combat_philosophy: Direct physical combat through strength and skill

ranged.description: Distance combat weapons for projectile-based attacks
ranged.combat_philosophy: Tactical combat through precision and positioning

spell_caster.description: Mystical weapons for magical combat and spell enhancement
spell_caster.combat_philosophy: Arcane combat through magical power and knowledge

stat_scaling.melee: Scales with Strength, Dexterity, and weapon-specific attributes
stat_scaling.ranged: Scales with Dexterity, Agility, and Perception
stat_scaling.spell_caster: Scales with Intelligence, Wisdom, and Mystical Power

enhancement_potential.all_types: Can be enhanced through smithing, enchantment, and divine blessing

divine_alignment.influence: All weapon types can manifest divine positioning characteristics
divine_alignment.manifestation: Divine alignment affects weapon appearance, special abilities, and combat effectiveness

combat_integration.description: Weapons work together with armor and jewelry to create complete combat builds
combat_integration.synergy_bonuses: Weapon choice influences optimal armor and jewelry selections

metadata.author: PrimalMyst Development Team
metadata.references: Referenced by all weapon-specific core files
